[list]  	[*][url=#requirements]CURSOR TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS [/url][/*]  	[*][url=#design]DESIGN CONSIDERATIONS [/url][/*]  	[*][url=#submission]INSTRUCTIONS FOR SUBMISSION [/url][/*]  	[*][url=#examples]EXAMPLE CURSOR PACK[/url][/*]  [/list]

[h2][url id=requirements][/url][/h2][h2]CURSOR TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS[/h2][list]  	[*]Each cursor must be 32 pixels by 32 pixels, 24-bit RGB color with 8-bit alpha channel.[/*]  	[*]The format of the resulting image must be bmp (with transparency).[/*]  	[*]It is no longer necessary to provide .ani files for cursors.[/*]  	[*]The hotspots locations for the cursors will be the same as those set for our default cursors.[/*]  [/list]

[url id=design][/url]

[h2]DESIGN CONSIDERATIONS[/h2][list]  	[*]The hues, greyscale values, and line widths of the cursors need to read well in all map locations and lighting situations.[/*]  	[*]The edges of the images should be as clean as possible. [/*]  	[*]Don't force a lot of details into the cursor images if it makes them too busy or hard to read. Keep the design simple and stylized to display as clearly as possible.[/*]  [/list]

[url id=submission][/url]

[h2]INSTRUCTIONS FOR SUBMISSION[/h2][list]  	[*]Refer to the [url=https://help.steampowered.com/en/faqs/view/3E00-D38F-B793-7384]Submitting Items[/url] page for important general information about testing and submitting items.[/*]  	[*]Cursor Packs are submitted under the "Images..." category.[/*]  	[*]The preview loadout will show an icon with the default cursors but you will see your cursors when you continue through to the game.[/*]  	[*]When done testing in game, return to the Workshop Tool and follow the steps to publish your Cursor Pack to the Workshop.[/*]  [/list]

[url id=examples][/url]

[h2]EXAMPLE CURSOR PACK[/h2]Download the [url=http://media.steampowered.com/apps/dota2/images/workshop/guidelines/cursors/example_valve_cursor_pack.zip]Valve Example Cursor Pack[/url]

[url=http://www.dota2.com/workshop/]Dota 2 Item Workshop Guidelines Homepage[/url]
